       6             : /* compile-time and runtime tests for whether to use SSE instructions */
       7             : 
       8             : #ifndef mozilla_SSE_h_
       9             : #define mozilla_SSE_h_
      10             : 
      11             : // for definition of MFBT_DATA
      12             : #include "mozilla/Types.h"
      13             : 
      14             : /**
      15             :  * The public interface of this header consists of a set of macros and
      16             :  * functions for Intel CPU features.
      17             :  *
      18             :  * DETECTING ISA EXTENSIONS
      19             :  * ========================
      20             :  *
      21             :  * This header provides the following functions for determining whether the
      22             :  * current CPU supports a particular instruction set extension:
      23             :  *
      24             :  *    mozilla::supports_mmx
      25             :  *    mozilla::supports_sse
      26             :  *    mozilla::supports_sse2
      27             :  *    mozilla::supports_sse3
      28             :  *    mozilla::supports_ssse3
      29             :  *    mozilla::supports_sse4a
      30             :  *    mozilla::supports_sse4_1
      31             :  *    mozilla::supports_sse4_2
      32             :  *    mozilla::supports_avx
      33             :  *    mozilla::supports_avx2
      34             :  *
      35             :  * If you're writing code using inline assembly, you should guard it with a
      36             :  * call to one of these functions.  For instance:
      37             :  *
      38             :  *   if (mozilla::supports_sse2()) {
      39             :  *     asm(" ... ");
      40             :  *   }
      41             :  *   else {
      42             :  *     ...
      43             :  *   }
      44             :  *
      45             :  * Note that these functions depend on cpuid intrinsics only available in gcc
      46             :  * 4.3 or later and MSVC 8.0 (Visual C++ 2005) or later, so they return false
      47             :  * in older compilers.  (This could be fixed by replacing the code with inline
      48             :  * assembly.)
      49             :  *
      50             :  *
      51             :  * USING INTRINSICS
      52             :  * ================
      53             :  *
      54             :  * This header also provides support for coding using CPU intrinsics.
      55             :  *
      56             :  * For each mozilla::supports_abc function, we define a MOZILLA_MAY_SUPPORT_ABC
      57             :  * macro which indicates that the target/compiler combination we're using is
      58             :  * compatible with the ABC extension.  For instance, x86_64 with MSVC 2003 is
      59             :  * compatible with SSE2 but not SSE3, since although there exist x86_64 CPUs
      60             :  * with SSE3 support, MSVC 2003 only supports through SSE2.
      61             :  *
      62             :  * Until gcc fixes #pragma target [1] [2] or our x86 builds require SSE2,
      63             :  * you'll need to separate code using intrinsics into a file separate from your
      64             :  * regular code.  Here's the recommended pattern:
      65             :  *
      66             :  *  #ifdef MOZILLA_MAY_SUPPORT_ABC
      67             :  *    namespace mozilla {
      68             :  *      namespace ABC {
      69             :  *        void foo();
      70             :  *      }
      71             :  *    }
      72             :  *  #endif
      73             :  *
      74             :  *  void foo() {
      75             :  *    #ifdef MOZILLA_MAY_SUPPORT_ABC
      76             :  *      if (mozilla::supports_abc()) {
      77             :  *        mozilla::ABC::foo(); // in a separate file
      78             :  *        return;
      79             :  *      }
      80             :  *    #endif
      81             :  *
      82             :  *    foo_unvectorized();
      83             :  *  }
      84             :  *
      85             :  * You'll need to define mozilla::ABC::foo() in a separate file and add the
      86             :  * -mabc flag when using gcc.
      87             :  *
      88             :  * [1] http://gcc.gnu.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=39787 and
      89             :  * [2] http://gcc.gnu.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=41201 being fixed.
      90             :  *
      91             :  */
      92             : 
      93             : #if defined(__GNUC__) && (defined(__i386__) || defined(__x86_64__))
      94             : 
      95             : #ifdef __MMX__
      96             :   // It's ok to use MMX instructions based on the -march option (or
      97             :   // the default for x86_64 or for Intel Mac).
      98             :   #define MOZILLA_PRESUME_MMX 1
      99             : #endif
     100             : #ifdef __SSE__
     101             :   // It's ok to use SSE instructions based on the -march option (or
     102             :   // the default for x86_64 or for Intel Mac).
     103             :   #define MOZILLA_PRESUME_SSE 1
     104             : #endif
     105             : #ifdef __SSE2__
     106             :   // It's ok to use SSE2 instructions based on the -march option (or
     107             :   // the default for x86_64 or for Intel Mac).
     108             :   #define MOZILLA_PRESUME_SSE2 1
     109             : #endif
     110             : #ifdef __SSE3__
     111             :   // It's ok to use SSE3 instructions based on the -march option (or the
     112             :   // default for Intel Mac).
     113             :   #define MOZILLA_PRESUME_SSE3 1
     114             : #endif
     115             : #ifdef __SSSE3__
     116             :   // It's ok to use SSSE3 instructions based on the -march option.
     117             :   #define MOZILLA_PRESUME_SSSE3 1
     118             : #endif
     119             : #ifdef __SSE4A__
     120             :   // It's ok to use SSE4A instructions based on the -march option.
     121             :   #define MOZILLA_PRESUME_SSE4A 1
     122             : #endif
     123             : #ifdef __SSE4_1__
     124             :   // It's ok to use SSE4.1 instructions based on the -march option.
     125             :   #define MOZILLA_PRESUME_SSE4_1 1
     126             : #endif
     127             : #ifdef __SSE4_2__
     128             :   // It's ok to use SSE4.2 instructions based on the -march option.
     129             :   #define MOZILLA_PRESUME_SSE4_2 1
     130             : #endif
     131             : #ifdef __AVX__
     132             :   // It's ok to use AVX instructions based on the -march option.
     133             :   #define MOZILLA_PRESUME_AVX 1
     134             : #endif
     135             : #ifdef __AVX2__
     136             :   // It's ok to use AVX instructions based on the -march option.
     137             :   #define MOZILLA_PRESUME_AVX2 1
     138             : #endif
     139             : 
     140             : 
     141             : 
     142             : #ifdef HAVE_CPUID_H
     143             :   #define MOZILLA_SSE_HAVE_CPUID_DETECTION
     144             : #endif
     145             : 
     146             : #elif defined(_MSC_VER) && (defined(_M_IX86) || defined(_M_AMD64))
     147             : 
     148             : #define MOZILLA_SSE_HAVE_CPUID_DETECTION
     149             : 
     150             : #if defined(_M_IX86_FP)
     151             : 
     152             : #if _M_IX86_FP >= 1
     153             :   // It's ok to use SSE instructions based on the /arch option
     154             :   #define MOZILLA_PRESUME_SSE
     155             : #endif
     156             : #if _M_IX86_FP >= 2
     157             :   // It's ok to use SSE2 instructions based on the /arch option
     158             :   #define MOZILLA_PRESUME_SSE2
     159             : #endif
     160             : 
     161             : #elif defined(_M_AMD64)
     162             :   // MSVC for AMD64 doesn't support MMX, so don't presume it here.
     163             : 
     164             :   // SSE is always available on AMD64.
     165             :   #define MOZILLA_PRESUME_SSE
     166             :   // SSE2 is always available on AMD64.
     167             :   #define MOZILLA_PRESUME_SSE2
     168             : #endif
     169             : 
     170             : #elif defined(__SUNPRO_CC) && (defined(__i386) || defined(__x86_64__))
     171             : // Sun Studio on x86 or amd64
     172             : 
     173             : #define MOZILLA_SSE_HAVE_CPUID_DETECTION
     174             : 
     175             : #if defined(__x86_64__)
     176             :   // MMX is always available on AMD64.
     177             :   #define MOZILLA_PRESUME_MMX
     178             :   // SSE is always available on AMD64.
     179             :   #define MOZILLA_PRESUME_SSE
     180             :   // SSE2 is always available on AMD64.
     181             :   #define MOZILLA_PRESUME_SSE2
     182             : #endif
     183             : 
     184             : #endif
